snippet: A newly released trove of internal emails and documents, mostly from 2006 and 2007, paint a troubling picture of how Credit Suisse operated as the housing bubble inflated.
abstract: Newly released trove of internal emails and documents, mostly from 2006 and 2007, paint troubling picture of how Credit Suisse operated as housing bubble inflated; documents, filed in Massachusetts state court as part of investor lawsuit, suggest that top officials at bank routinely pressed subordinates to override due diligence standards and accept questionable loans that were subsequently bundled into mortgage investments.
lead_paragraph: A newly released trove of internal emails and documents, mostly from 2006 and 2007, paint a troubling picture of how Credit Suisse operated as the housing bubble inflated.

headline.main: Credit Suisse Documents Point to Mortgage Lapses
headline.print_headline: Credit Suisse Documents Point to Mortgage Lapses
